attributes.action: …introduce legislation to ensure the continuation of free banking for those citizens in credit, and protect poor and vulnerable citizens from exploitation and overcharging by the banking industry within the UK.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Banks are set to announce record profits of more than £40 Billion, but it is emerging that industry leaders believe that the existing profit margin is insufficient. The average profit per customer has risen by a staggering 83% since 1997.

Several executives have gone on record to say that fee based banking is a fairer proposition, in contrast to the existing arrangement of fee charging.

We believe that any such charge is patently unfair, and is also a direct attack upon all customers regardless of income or financial status. The disabled, poor and sick will all suffer and find it hard to justify the additional expenditure of £120+ per year.

In addition, we are also of the opinion that this charge will be introduced as a direct response to an ever increasing number of customers, who have successfully recovered overdraft and credit card fees.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
